comment.author: 62921122@N00
comment._content:
I agree, "Jap" is a very insensitive, unkind, and uneducated way to describe a Japanese person. It's commonly used to express disrespectfulness, hatefulness or displeasure towards a person because he/she is a Japanese. It was obviously spelled out on the photo itself, and you weren't pressed for space, so was it necessary to abbreviate like so? If you insist on abbreviating, please use the internationally accepted abbreviation, "JP", or presenting the complete spelling. also here:

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Thanks for understanding that no offense is intended. We retain the original title of a photograph as part of preserving the historical record. The Bain News Service photo titles are available from several sources—typed in the set of caption cards consulted while making the scans, hand-written on an older set of cards, and etched on the negatives themselves. Abbreviated spellings are common in each source, but, in this case, the sources differ. Transcribing the fuller title directly from the negative provides more information, and that source is now used.
